name: Hard My Millionaire Quiz | Mixed 15 Questions | 15 Questions

questions.text: What color would the sky most likely be on a sunny day?
questions.explanation:
Blue.

	Hopefully you didn't have to waste a lifeline on that one.

questions.text: Which season would you be most worried about the wind chill factor?

questions.correct: Named after a rich NY enclave
questions.explanation:
Named after a rich NY enclave.

	By Griswold Lorillard in 1886.

questions.text: What is the chemical formula for water?
questions.explanation:
H2O.

	If you are confused between water and sulphuric acid just remember this: Farmer Brown is dead and gone, alas, he is no more, for what he thought was H2O was H2SO4.

questions.text: Which two flavors make up the taste of the soft drink 'Sprite'?
On the TV show 'The Simpsons', which of the following is NOT a first name of somebody with the last name of Simpson?
questions.explanation:
Selma.

	Bart and Lisa are obvious and Abraham is better known as Grandpa Simpson.

questions.text: Which two countries hosted the 2002 FIFA World Cup in Soccer?
Which of the following cities was NOT the setting for one of the 'Die Hard' movies with Bruce Willis?
questions.explanation:
San Francisco.

	"Die Hard" was in Los Angeles, "Die Harder" was in Washington DC and "Die Hard with a Vengeance" was in New York City.

questions.text: Whose point of view is the novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird' told from?
questions.explanation:
Scout's.

	It's told through the eyes of Scout, Atticus's daughter.

questions.text: In which month of the year is the Earth the closest to the nearest star?
questions.explanation:
December.

	While the northern hemisphere starts their winter in this month, December is when the Earth is closest to the closest star, our sun. While this may seem counterintuitive to many people, what affect the cold weather is not the distance from the sun, but the angle at which the Earth is facing the sun.

questions.text: If you were attending Miami University, which U.S. state would you be in?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	Remember this was the {$64,000} question. The University of Miami is in Miami Florida while Miami University is in Oxford, Ohio (just outside Cincinnati).

questions.text: Who received the 2000 Patsy Montana Entertainer Award?
How much U.S. dollars does the winner of the World Championship of Monopoly win?
questions.explanation:
$15,400.

	This amount corresponds to how much Monopoly money is each game of the U.S. version.

questions.text: Which artist painted 'The Tree of Crows' which can be found in The Louvre in Paris?
Who is listed as the writer of the Sheena Easton song 'Sugar Walls'?
questions.explanation:
Alexander Nevermind.

	Well, did you win the million? Yes, Alexander Nevermind is Prince but this was the name he used as the writer of the song. Of other note, Christopher is the name Prince used for the Bangles song 'Manic Monday'. Also if you won a million, don't wait by the mailbox for a check because if I sent you a million dollar check it would bounce all the way to the sun and burn up.
